channel.title: Mike Allen
channel.description: Recent news about Mike Allen, from openparliament.ca.

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: Great eve @ Potato World Hall of recognition. Congrats to families of Gaylon Crain, David Frost, & Frederick Pirie Sr/Jr, this yrs inductees

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: 5M interval run this am. Paperwork day, some lawn work, then off to Potato World in F'ville-Bristol for Hall of Recognition Dinner this eve

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: Wrapped up the day with a cross-training workout @GoodLifeFitness Brookside Mall. Feels good when its over.

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: Woodstock office this morning for meetings & then some time on the BBQ at Murray's Irving Trucker Appreciation days. Great to see everyone

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: Interesting visit with the guys running the Drone project for @POTATOESNB. Technology to assess fields is amazing http://t.co/vuMxr3d554

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: + investment in efficiencies RT @RobMoore_CPC: Site tour with @mpmikea at LaForge Doors...specialized manufacturer http://t.co/XmSONCYoWe

item.title: Mentioned by Calgary Herald
item.description:
Thomson: 'Profound lapse' erodes MLA's ability to do his job
When Conservative MP Steven Fletcher learned he had been dropped from the federal cabinet on Monday, he said jokingly on Twitter, “I wish I left Cabinet in the traditional way — with a sex scandal!” Then on Tuesday, we had the story of Alberta MLA Mike Allen's arrest in Minnesota — a reminder that there's really nothing humorous about a sex scandal, especially one that, in the sobering words of St. Paul authorities, is tied to a police sting aimed at “human trafficking and the promotion of prostitution.” Allen hasn't ...

item.title: Mentioned by 570 News
item.description:
Conservative Alberta MP arrested in prostitution sting
Mike Allen, the member of the legislature for Fort McMurray, was arrested by St. Paul police Monday night. Allen, who is 51, was in the city attending a legislative conference. The website of the St. Paul Pioneer Press reports that police allege Allen responded ...

item.title: Mentioned by Farm Focus
item.description:
Growing Forward 2 launched in New Brunswick
Growing Forward 2 was launched in New Brunswick on July 9. In the photo are from left: Tobique-Mactaquac MP Mike Allen; Carol and Richard Boonstoppel, owners of a dairy farm in Scotch Lake, their children, and NB Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries.
